sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The maxx function is used to determine the maximum value of x for the current graphics mode.
sections.text_content: The maxx function is used to determine the maximum value of x for the current graphics mode.
sections.mdown_content: The **maxx** function is used to determine the maximum value of x for the current graphics mode.

sections.title: Example
code:
setscreen ("graphics")
        Â…
        put "The maximum x value is ", maxx
sections.raw_content: This program outputs the maximum x value.
sections.text_content: This program outputs the maximum x value.
sections.mdown_content: This program outputs the maximum x value.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
The screen should be in a "graphics" mode. If it is not, it will automatically be set to "graphics" mode. See setscreen for details.

For the default IBM PC compatible graphics mode (CGA), maxx = 319.
sections.text_content:
The screen should be in a "graphics" mode. If it is not, it will automatically be set to "graphics" mode. See setscreen for details.
For the default IBM PC compatible graphics mode (CGA), maxx = 319.
sections.mdown_content:
The screen should be in a "_graphics_" mode. If it is not, it will automatically be set to "_graphics_" mode. See **setscreen** for details.

For the default IBM PC compatible graphics mode (CGA), **maxx** = 319.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported unqualified.

This means that you can call the function by calling maxx or by calling View.maxx.
sections.text_content:
Exported unqualified.
This means that you can call the function by calling maxx or by calling View.maxx.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported unqualified.

This means that you can call the function by calling **maxx** or by calling **View.maxx**.
